intro: Philodice cuyabensis, commonly known as the Cuyabén philodice, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in humid forests and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
